Articles.Content:
I've posted an update for 1.0.4 on Kerbalstuff:

https://kerbalstuff.com/mod/741/HotRockets

Updated 6/29/2015

- added compound effect for Turbojet engine

- added compound effect for rapier engine

- added effect for Flea SRB

- added two small fx files : flamejet2 and flamejet4

- addressed issue with jet engine exhaust at 0 thrust

- addressed rocket smoke plume size on larger rocket engines

- addressed launch smoke effect not appearing on Nasa engines

- addressed 1.03 change for basic jet engine moduleengines

Oh and just curious, what does zAtmo_hotrockets.cfg do? I deleted it last update and had nothing change.

It makes plumes expand with decreasing atmospheric density.

Yay! Better Fx again! I'll download it after asking something. I just love the gorgeous looking new SR-71 style turboramjet exhaust Fx. How can I disable your Fx for the turboramjet so it uses the squad ones? But good work with the other ones, they make engines even cooler than they now are!

It makes plumes expand with decreasing atmospheric density.

Oh... WHOOPS

Edited June 28, 2015 by Avera9eJoe

How can I disable your Fx for the turboramjet so it uses the squad ones?

Find the entry for the turboramjet and remove it (squad_hotrockets.cfg)

Sorry, the SmokeScreen bug is my fault, I mis-set the default parameters in two of the new fields. Hopefully Sarbian can incorporate my fix soon, but in the meantime here's a dll with the fix built-in:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/ccvvrgf09a257bb/SmokeScreen_dll_2.6.5a.zip?dl=0

Yes,about smoke in space.You can delete launch_hotrockets.cfg from \KSP_win\GameData\MP_Nazari.

What will i be losing by doing this?
Or just change the emission rate to zero at zero density in the config.

Or just change the emission rate to zero at zero density in the config.

From my understanding of the config it already is 0 at 0 density


        emission = 0.0 0.0  // Curve for emission like stock
        emission = 0.05 0.0  // Curve for emission like stock
        emission = 0.2 0.5  // Curve for emission like stock
        emission = 1.0 1.8  // Curve for emission like stock

        emission = 0.0 0.0  // Curve for emission like stock
        emission = 0.05 0.0  // Curve for emission like stock
        emission = 0.2 0.5  // Curve for emission like stock

Try changing emission = 0.05 0.0 to emission = 0.1 0.0 and changing emission = 0.2 0.5 to something like emission = 0.3 0.5

Launch smoke that is now incredibly laggy with the new stock launch/surface smoke.

Try changing emission = 0.05 0.0 to emission = 0.1 0.0 and changing emission = 0.2 0.5 to something like emission = 0.3 0.5 .

tried that but it really didn't help so I removed the config for now, thanks for the help

Can somebody help me with this (perceived) problem?

http://imgur.com/bKT4cGX

All my engines seem to do this ball of fire thing when I launch. Am I doing it wrong?

From my understanding of the config it already is 0 at 0 density


        emission = 0.0 0.0  // Curve for emission like stock
        emission = 0.05 0.0  // Curve for emission like stock
        emission = 0.2 0.5  // Curve for emission like stock
        emission = 1.0 1.8  // Curve for emission like stock

Not quite, that adjusts it by throttle, by default. Try like this:


emission 
{
  density = 1 1
  density = 0.01 1
  density = 0 0
}

That'll set it properly, leave in the original emission parameters, so it's still adjusted by throttle.

- - - Updated - - -

I'm having an issue with the rocket exhaust... All the emitted particles seem to bunch up right at their emission point. This happens with all engines, on a clean Hotrockets install (I didn't touch any of the files). Anyone having a similar problem and/or knows a fix?
